member.summary: constructor_initializesAsyncSettings class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.JobTimeoutLockedInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval used to query to see if there are any organization maintenance jobs that have timed out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.MaxJobExecutionTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used for organization maintenance jobs to determine if a job has timed out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.MaxRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times an asynchronous job will retry before it fails or suspends.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.MaxStateStatusUpdateMaxRetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times a database operation will be attempted before failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.OrgDatabaseMaintenanceJobInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval used to query to see if there is a pending organization maintenance job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.RetryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the default rate of back-off for failed asynchronous operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.SdkRootDomain
member.summary: Gets or sets the root domain used for calls into the pn_microsoftcrm service from the asynchronous service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.SelectInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval used to determine if new asynchronous operations should be loaded into memory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.AsyncSettings.TimeoutLockedInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval used to query to see if there are any asynchronous operations that have timed out.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ImportUserMappingMethod
member.summary: Defines the possible methods for mapping users when importing an organization.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ImportUserMappingMethod.ByAccount
member.summary: Specifies to automatically map the users' pn_Active_Directory account names to pn_microsoftcrm accounts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ImportUserMappingMethod.ByMappingXml
member.summary: Specifies custom user account matching options in an XML string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ImportUserMappingMethod.KeepExisting
member.summary: Specifies to keep the existing user mappings in the organization database. Typically, you select this option if you are importing an organization database that is located in the same pn_Active_Directory domain as the pn_microsoftcrm Server where the organization is to be imported. For users external to the pn_Active_Directory domain, who were added with their UPN, the user information will be mapped across without any changes or validation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles
member.summary: Describes specific server functionality, components, and services.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.ApiServer
member.summary: Specifies the role that allows programmatic access to the organization Web service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.AppServer
member.summary: Specifies the role that runs the Web application server that is used to connect users to Microsoft Dynamics CRM data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.AsyncService
member.summary: Specifies the role that allows processing of queued asynchronous events, such as workflows, asynchronous plug-ins, bulk e-mail, or data import.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.DeploymentManagementTools
member.summary: Specifies the role that allows the use of the pn_deploymentmanager and pn_PowerShell cmdlets. pn_microsoftcrm administrators can use the pn_PowerShell cmdlets to automate Deployment Manager tasks. pn_deploymentmanager is a Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in that system administrators can use to manage organizations, servers, and licenses for deployments of pn_microsoftcrm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.DeploymentService
member.summary: Specifies the role that allows programmatic access to deployment management.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.DiscoveryService
member.summary: Specifies the role that allows discovery of organizations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.HelpServer
member.summary: Specifies the role that makes pn_microsoftcrm help available to users.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.None
member.summary: Specifies no roles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.SandboxServer
member.summary: Specifies the role that enables an isolated environment for the execution of custom code, such as plug-ins. This isolated environment reduces the possibility of custom code affecting the operation of the organizations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.SqlServer
member.summary: Specifies the role that installs the configuration database (MSCRM_CONFIG) on the SQL Server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Deployment.ServerRoles.SrsDataConnector
member.summary: Specifies the role that provides reporting functionality by interfacing with the pn_microsoftcrm system and pn_SQL_Server_Reporting.
